properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 4:14PM CST until January 13 at 1:20PM CST by NWS Paducah KY
properties.description:
Skillet Fork River at Wayne City

.River levels along the Skillet Fork River are rising due to heavy
rainfall of 1 to 2 inches that has fallen over the past 24 hours
combined with additional heavy rain forecast over the next 36 hours.
Major flooding is now forecast to occur at Wayne City with a crest
around 20.2 feet Saturday night. This would be the highest crest
since May 2017 when it crested at 22.8 feet.

The Flood Warning continues for
the Skillet Fork River at Wayne City
* from late tonight to Monday afternoon.
* At  3:00 PM Friday the stage was 10.6 feet.
* Flood Stage is 15.0 feet.
* Major flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...Rise above flood stage by early tomorrow and continue to
rise to near 20.2 feet by early Sunday morning. the river will fall
below flood stage by Monday morning.
properties.instruction:
SAFETY MESSAGE...

Never drive cars...trucks or sport utility vehicles through flooded
areas. The water may be too deep to allow safe passage. Never allow
children to play in or near flood waters. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather
Radio or your local media for further statements and possible updated
forecasts.

Additional information is available at
http://www.crh.noaa.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=pah /lower case/
